original: @41a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @41a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bighn'anta ka s'a dha nam /
analyzed: bighn'anta ka s'a dha nam /
translated: Vighnāntakasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bgegs bskrad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: bgegs bskrad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining the Vanquisher of Obstacles

original: bcom ldan 'das bgegs mthar byed la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bgegs mthar byed la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Vanquisher of Obstacles.

original: dang po re zhig sgrub pa po bde ba'i gdan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sgrub pa po bde ba'i gdan la 'dug ste /
translated: First, the practitioner sits on a comfortable seat,

original: rang gi snying gar aam dmar po las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar aam dmar po las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la /
translated: and visualizes a sun maṇḍala arisen from a red AṂ in his heart.

original: de'i steng du h'um sngon po rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um sngon po rnam par bsams nas /
translated: On top of that, he imagines a blue HŪṂ.

original: h'um gi 'od las skyes pa'i bgegs mthar byed dang / bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dmigs la /
analyzed: h'um gi 'od las skyes pa'i bgegs mthar byed dang / bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dmigs la /
translated: From the light of the HŪṂ, he visualizes the Vanquisher of Obstacles, the guru, the buddhas, and the bodhisattvas,

original: me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: and makes offerings with flowers and so forth.

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having prostrated and gone for refuge, and so forth, he should meditate on emptiness.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ

original: de nas aam dmar po las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um ngo //
analyzed: de nas aam dmar po las skyes pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um ngo //
translated: Then, on a sun maṇḍala arisen from a red aṃ, there is a hūṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: That completely transforms into

original: rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: a vajra marked with hūṃ.🔽All tathāgatas are invoked by the light rays of the hūṃ.

original: h'um gi 'od kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa'i sngon du 'gro bas de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bgegs dgra bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: h'um gi 'od kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa'i sngon du 'gro bas de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bgegs dgra bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Having made offerings to them, all of that completely transforms into oneself as Vighnāntakṛt.

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: One has one face and two hands.

original: g-yon pa brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
translated: One stands with the left leg straight.

original: mdog sngo ba phyag g-yon na sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa /
analyzed: mdog sngo ba phyag g-yon na sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa /
translated: One’s color is blue, with a threatening gesture and a noose in the left [hand],

original: g-yas pa na rdo rje 'phyar zhing 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa na rdo rje 'phyar zhing 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: and a raised vajra in the right hand, terrifying.

original: skra kham pa gyen du bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: skra kham pa gyen du bsgreng ba'o //
translated: One’s tawny hair is upward-streaming.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa'o //
translated: Then, in the heart of the Bhagavat, hūṃ completely transforms into a vajra marked with hūṃ.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bgegs dgra spro ba dang bsdu ba'i gzugs sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bgegs dgra spro ba dang bsdu ba'i gzugs sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma la gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the form of the obstructor-enemy, which is of various kinds, expanding and contracting, on a lotus, situated on a sun.

original: dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas 'di ltar thun mtshams gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi la sogs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas 'di ltar thun mtshams gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi la sogs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having gone through the rite of commitment and so forth, one should meditate in this way in two, three, four, and so on, sessions.

original: aom a'a:bighn'anta krita h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a:bighn'anta krita h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vigantakṛt hūṃ phaṭ.

original: bgegs dgra'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: bgegs dgra'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
translated: The method of achieving the obstructor-enemy is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so//
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so//
translated: The paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the Khampa translator-editor Gelongmawa translated and revised it.
